race.name: Draconian
entries: Being thought of as a different race branched from the dragon line, they are a proud race fully believing this fact even though it has never been confirmed. While Draconians societies are not common as they are known to be nomads traveling alone or in small groups, they congregate before floods in the sanctuary. Draconians hatch after the floods are over.

entries.name: Ability Score Enhancement
entries: Chose any ability score that did not get increased by 1. Increase that ability score by 2.
Chose your Strength or Charisma ability score. Increase that ability score's maximum by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Draconians have inherited some of the longevity of their Dragon forefathers. Although able to walk early after hatching, they age slowly, reaching adulthood at around 30-40 years, with variation mostly dependant on scale color. Draconians can almost reach 400 years of age.

entries.name: Size
entries: Draconians are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Thanks to your draconic heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: Your draconic ancestry gives you special abilities. Choose a type of dragon from the table below. The type you choose influences your breath weapon and your damage resistance.

entries.name: Knowledge of the Ages
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill history} and {@skill intimidation} skills.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: You can use your action to exhale destructive energy. Your draconic ancestry determines size, shape, and damage of the exhalation. Every creature in the area of a effect needs to make a saving throw against a DC of 8 + any ability score bonus of your choice + your proficiency. The damage equals {@damage 4d6} on a failed save, and have as much on a successful one. The damage increases by {@damage 1d6} at levels 6, 11, and 16.
After you use Breath Weapon, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: True neutral, they live nomadic lifes often avoiding contact with other races as their pights are not their own and the challenges of their nomadic way of life are their own just the same.

entries.name: Draconian Names
entries: Name Generator

race.name: Gnome
entries: Gnomes, unlike their amicable brethren the Halflings, are known to be a bit more distant and crude. They care more for themselves and others of their race and will almost never help others without a reward in return.

entries.name: Ability Score Enhancement
entries: Chose any ability score that did not get increased by 1. Increase that ability score by 2.
Chose your Dexterity or Intelligence ability score. Increase that ability score's maximum by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gnomes mature at the same rate as humans, their lifespans, however, tend to be longer. A gnome can reach almost 150 years of age.

entries.name: Size
entries: Gnomes average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: You have advantage on all INT, WIS, and CHA saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnomish.

race.name: Gigas
entries: The Gigas are a race that is told to be decendant from giants, however similarly to Draconians this has never been confirmed. Unlike the Draconians thought, they are known to stay and protect places they like.

entries.name: Ability Score Enhancement
entries: Chose any ability score that did not get increased by 1. Increase that ability score by 2.
Chose your Strength or Wisdom ability score. Increase that ability score's maximum by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gigas age slower than humans, and reach adulthood once they have seen 75 summers. averaging a lifespan of about 500 years.

entries.name: Size
entries: Gigas are by far the largest race on the face of Deoir. An average Gigas reaches heights of over 8 feet and weighs over 300 pounds. Your size is Large.

entries.name: Natural Athlete
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Gigas Hardiness
entries: When you take damage, you can choose to use your reaction to shrug off the blow. Roll a d12 + your CON modifier. And substract the result from the damage taken. You can't use this feature again until you have finished a short or long rest.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries: Your are acclimatized to a region of your choice as per the DMG. You also have resistance to cold, fire or poison damage.

entries.name: Brutal Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Giant.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Lawful good, they uphold the laws of the cities they have decided becomes their home and oft found in the guard of said city upholding the values of the populace.

entries.name: Gigas Names
entries: Name Generator

race.name: Gnoll
entries: Gnolls are not often seen in settlements unless floods are happening. Not much is known about them except for them keeping to themselves and that they always travel in packs. However, it is rumored that they did not exist before the Ascension.

entries.name: Ability Score Enhancement
entries: Chose any ability score that did not get increased by 1. Increase that ability score by 2.
Chose your Constitution or Dexterity ability score. Increase that ability score's maximum by 2.

entries.name: Appearance
entries: Gnolls have features from all types of Canines and Hyaenidae, but where they have gained these features from is unknown.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gnolls have shorter lifespans than humans. They reach maturity at about 10 years old and can live to 50.

entries.name: Size
entries: Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Your eyes are used to a cathemeral lifestyle and grant you superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of grey.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated|Deoir}.

entries.name: Vicious Fangs
entries: Your unarmed attacks deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier. If you have another feature or effect that modifies the die size of your unarmed attacks, that die size instead increases by 1 step if you use your fangs to attack.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Tireless Wanderer
entries: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws against exhaustion made as a result of a forced march.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnoll.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: None.

entries.name: Gnoll Names
entries: Name Generator

race.name: Human
entries: Humans inhabit all kinds of places on Deoir. Not really known for anything specific except for being quite versatile and having a broad spectrum of views.

entries.name: Ability Score Enhancement
entries: Chose any ability score that did not get increased by 1. Increase that ability score by 2.
Chose any ability score. Decrease that ability score by 1.
Chose any ability score. Increase that ability score's maximum by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and rarely live past 70.

entries.name: Size
entries: Humans vary wildly in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice.

entries.name: Skill Versatility
entries: You gain proficiency in 3 extra skills of your choice.

entries.name: Natural Talent
entries: You gain one feat of your choice.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Humans tend to no particular alignment by nature, although the aftermath of the Great War has made many of them bitter and resentful. One is as likely to find idealistic heroes as depraved villains among them, most of them fall somewhere in the middle.

entries.name: Human Names
entries: Often similar to the names of the cultures they are apart of. Dominantly human settlements often use names like: Name Generator

race.name: Orc
entries: Orcs are known to be strong fighters, often seen in gladiatorial arenas. They are not known to make their own cities, instead claiming their own territory as they are satisfied with what is already there for them.

entries.name: Ability Score Enhancement
entries: Chose any ability score that did not get increased by 1. Increase that ability score by 2.
Chose your Strength or Constitution ability score. Increase that ability score's maximum by 2.

entries.name: Age
entries: Orcs mature slightly faster than Humans, reaching adulthood in their early teens. They also age noticeably faster. An orc rarely lives past his 60th year.

entries.name: Size
entries: Orcs are taller and much bulkier than humans. They easily surpass 6 feet in height and average over 200 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Menacing
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill.

entries.name: Fearless
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened|Deoir}.

entries.name: Tireless
entries: If you gain a level of exhaustion, you can use a bonus action to remove it. You can't use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Furious Charge
entries: Once per turn, as part of a melee weapon attack, you can move up to your speed in a straight line towards a target of your choice.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Savage Attacks
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice (and only the weapon's own damage dice) again and add the result to the total.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Primal Intuition
entries: You have proficiency in {@skill Survival}.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orcish.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: None.

entries.name: Orc Names
entries: Name Generator

subrace.name: Forest
entries: <hr/>Forest Gnomes are known tricksters and bandits, often seen with animals in tow to help rob their unfortunate victims. For this reason, forest gnomes are scorned in the cities and not trusted. This forces more Gnomes to turn to robbery to sustain themselves.

entries.name: Natural Illusionist
entries: You know the {@spell Minor Illusion|Ishiir} cantrip. Your spellcasting ability for it is INT, WIS, or CHA (your choice).

entries.name: Speak with Small Beasts
entries: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest gnomes love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

entries.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: You can attempt to hide even if you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

entries.name: Forest Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to hide in natural terrain.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: True Neutral, while often forced into a life of crime most forest gnomes do not take pleasure in this way of life and likely would choose otherwise should they have the chance.

entries.name: Forest Gnome Names
entries: First Name, Last Name

subrace.name: Rock
entries: <hr/>Rock Gnomes are known crafters like the Dwarves, although unlike them they are also known to try to extort their customers.

entries.name: Expert Crafter
entries: You gain proficiency in two tools of your choice.

entries.name: Artificer's Lore
entries: Whenever you make an INT-check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you have advantage on the check.

entries.name: Gnome Tinkerer
entries: You have proficiency with artisan's tools (tinker's tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp).

items.name: Clockwork Toy
items.entry: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

items.name: Fire Starter
items.entry: The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.

items.name: Music Box
items.entry: When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Typical Alignment
entries: Lawful evil, cunning in their trade while upholding laws and values they have, they will always be twisted in favor of themselves.

entries.name: Rock Gnome Names
entries: Name Generator
